name: European Hydrogen Association EHA
legal: International Not for Profit Association under Belgian Law
goal:
The EHA represents 8 national hydrogen and fuel cell clusters and expert groups active in accelerating the integration of hydrogen as an energy carrier, zero emission fuel and storage medium in the global transition to non-fossil based energy and transport systems. Its unique membership structure enables the EHA to have up-close insight in national and local developments and to communicate important issues regarding industrial and regulatory needs to key decision makers at EU and national level.

Main activities:
1. promoting H2 as an important energy carrier in a low carbon economy;
2. providing a point of reference for EU, national and local decision makers on fuel cells and hydrogen infrastructure development;
3. ensuring visibility of hydrogen and fuel cells in EU institutions;
4. explaining the role of H2 in Europe's future energy mix;
5. paving the way for large scale hydrogen infrastructure build-up linking (renewable) energy networks with transport networks and industrial demand networks, also in emerging and developing countries;
6. facilitating development of urban integrated hydrogen projects as part of an electric transport system;
7. supporting developments in European Regions:
8. contributing to relevant EU Programmes; FCH JU, TEN T, CEF, Horizon 2020 IEE etc.
9. supporting secretariat for educational activities in Europe:
10.ensuring high media visibility of the use of fuel cells and hydrogen .
interests: Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Education and training, Energy, Environment, International co-operation and development, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Cooperation with the EU Joint Undertaking Fuel Cell and Hydrogen, Energy Union, Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Directive,  Fuel Quality Directive, Renewable Energy Directive, Internal Energy Market Directive, Gas Package 2019
